data.title: The Broadcast Pioneers of Philadelphia
data.text:
Charlie Mills

Broadcast Pioneers member Charlie Mills is a veteran of 30 years in broadcasting. He has served in many capacities including Program Director, Music Director, Air Talent and Production Director in the Philadelphia, Tampa Bay and Atlantic City radio markets.

Charlie was heard for years in New York City, Philadelphia, Hartford, Long Island and other markets as the familiar voice for Tract Advertising's Valley Forge and Westbury Music Fairs (owned by Broadcast Pioneers members Shelly Gross & Frank Ford).

Mills has been the image voice for various radio stations on the east coast, and has produced, voiced and written thousands of commercials and promos while associated with WPEN and WMGK in Philadelphia, and WSUN AND WYUU in Tampa. Charlie left the broadcasting industry in 2000 to concentrate on Millsmedia Productions.

Charlie Mills Resume

Charlie also worked at WDVL-FM, Vineland, New Jersey, WWBZ Radio, Vineland, New Jersey, and WMVB in Millville, New Jersey.

Related Experience

Voice Talent for spots airing in New York City, Philadelphia, Wilmington, Baltimore, Washington, DC, Miami, Tampa Bay, Pittsburgh, and others. Advised Adult Standards stations in Atlantic City, New Jersey (WMID) and in

San Antonio, Texas (KTSA)

From the official archives of the Broadcast Pioneers of Philadelphia
